m-0.name: The Fool
m-0.meaning: beginnings, spontaneity, innocence, unpredictability, new journeys
m-0.description: A young man about to step off a cliff, a small dog at his heels.

m-1.name: The Magician
m-1.reversed: manipulation, poor planning, untapped potential, latent talents
m-1.description: A magician with one hand pointing to the sky and the other to the ground.

m-2.name: The High Priestess
m-2.meaning: intuition, subconscious, mystery, the unknown, hidden knowledge
m-2.reversed: secrets, disconnected from intuition, withdrawal, lack of clarity
m-2.description: A woman seated between two pillars, holding a scroll with the Torah, a crescent moon at her feet.

m-3.name: The Empress
m-3.reversed: infertility, dependence on others, creative block, neglect
m-3.description: A pregnant woman in a garden, a shield with a Venus symbol behind her.

m-4.name: The Emperor
m-4.description: A stern-looking emperor on a stone throne, holding an ankh and globe.

m-5.name: The Hierophant
m-5.meaning: spiritual guidance, conformity, tradition, institutions, faith
m-5.description: A religious figure with two acolytes, two pillars, and a triple crown.

m-6.name: The Lovers
m-6.reversed: disharmony, separation, unwise choices, conflict, values clash
m-6.description: A man and a woman with an angel above, standing before a tree.

m-7.name: The Chariot
m-7.reversed: lack of direction, lack of control, aggression, obstacles, discord
m-7.description: A charioteer with two opposing sphinxes, often in motion.

m-8.name: Strength
m-8.meaning: courage, inner strength, patience, compassion, power
m-8.reversed: self-doubt, weakness, insecurity, lack of control, manipulation
m-8.description: A woman with a lion, often depicted as gently taming it.

m-9.name: The Hermit
m-9.meaning: solitude, introspection, guidance, solitude, inner guidance
m-9.reversed: isolation, loneliness, withdrawal, stubbornness, refusal to seek help
m-9.description: An old man with a staff, lantern, and hooded cloak in the mountains.

m-10.name: Wheel of Fortune
m-10.reversed: bad luck, unforeseen events, resistance to change, cycles stalled
m-10.description: A wheel with figures and creatures, turning clockwise.

m-11.name: Justice
m-11.reversed: injustice, dishonesty, bias, legal issues, lack of accountability
m-11.description: A woman with a scale and sword, often blindfolded.

m-12.name: The Hanged Man
m-12.meaning: sacrifice, release, letting go, suspension, new perspective
m-12.reversed: selfishness, resistance to change, delaying, martyrdom, narrow perspective
m-12.description: A man hanging upside down by one foot from a tree.

m-13.name: Death
m-13.meaning: endings, transformation, change, new beginnings, rebirth
m-13.reversed: resistance to change, holding on, stagnation, fear of the unknown
m-13.description: A skeletal figure, often on a white horse, with people in its path.

m-14.name: Temperance
m-14.reversed: imbalance, excess, disharmony, impatience, lack of synthesis
m-14.description: An angel with two cups, pouring liquid between them.

m-15.name: The Devil
m-15.reversed: release, enlightenment, freedom, breaking free, newfound clarity
m-15.description: A horned devil figure with two chained humans in front of him.

m-16.name: The Tower
m-16.meaning: sudden upheaval, revelation, chaos, awakening, unexpected change
m-16.reversed: avoidance of disaster, delaying the inevitable, resisting change
m-16.description: A tower struck by lightning, with figures falling from it.

m-17.name: The Star
m-17.reversed: lack of faith, despair, unfulfilled hopes, disappointment, gloom
m-17.description: A woman pouring water into a pool, with stars above.

m-18.name: The Moon
m-18.meaning: illusion, intuition, the subconscious, fear, confusion
m-18.reversed: release of fear, confusion lifted, clarity, illumination, intuition
m-18.description: Two dogs and a wolf howling at the moon, with a crayfish in a pool.

m-19.name: The Sun
m-19.reversed: temporary depression, lack of success, cloudy outlook, negativity
m-19.description: A young child on a white horse, with sunflowers and a bright sun.

m-20.name: Judgment
m-20.reversed: self-doubt, refusal to change, ignoring a wake-up call, lack of self-reflection
m-20.description: An angel with a trumpet, with people rising from coffins below.

m-21.name: The World
m-21.reversed: incomplete, lack of closure, stagnation, unfulfilled potential
m-21.description: A figure holding a staff in a circle, surrounded by four animals.

w-1.name: Ace of Wands
w-1.meaning: inspiration, new beginnings, creation, potential, energy
w-1.reversed: lack of direction, delays, missed opportunities, unfulfilled potential
w-1.description: A hand holding a wand with leaves and buds sprouting from it.

w-2.name: Two of Wands
w-2.meaning: planning, decisions, progress, future, personal power
w-2.reversed: lack of planning, fear of change, playing it safe, limited vision
w-2.description: A man holding a globe, looking out over a castle.

w-3.name: Three of Wands
w-3.reversed: lack of foresight, delays, missed opportunities, unfulfilled potential
w-3.description: A man watching ships sail, holding three wands.

w-4.name: Four of Wands
w-4.reversed: lack of harmony, disrupted celebration, family conflicts, tension
w-4.description: People celebrating with wands and garlands.

w-5.name: Five of Wands
w-5.reversed: inner conflict, conflict avoidance, resolving differences, peace
w-5.description: Five people with wands, engaged in a competitive struggle.

w-6.name: Six of Wands
w-6.meaning: victory, public recognition, progress, self-confidence, triumph
w-6.reversed: lack of recognition, ego issues, self-doubt, fear of failure
w-6.description: A man on a horse, holding a wand, parading with laurel wreaths.

w-7.name: Seven of Wands
w-7.meaning: defensiveness, courage, determination, perseverance, standing your ground
w-7.reversed: giving in, backing down, feeling overwhelmed, surrender
w-7.description: A man on a hill, defending himself against six wands.

w-8.name: Eight of Wands
w-8.meaning: swift action, messages, quick decisions, travel, movement
w-8.reversed: delays, frustration, miscommunication, obstacles, slowing down
w-8.description: Eight wands flying through the air.

w-9.name: Nine of Wands
w-9.meaning: resilience, determination, inner strength, persistence, recovery
w-9.reversed: exhaustion, giving up, overwhelmed, lack of resilience, surrender
w-9.description: A man with a bandage on his head, leaning on a wand.

w-10.name: Ten of Wands
w-10.meaning: burden, responsibility, overload, stress, hard work
w-10.reversed: relief, delegation, letting go, release, lightening the load
w-10.description: A man carrying a heavy load of wands on his back.

w-11.name: Page of Wands
w-11.meaning: exploration, excitement, discovery, curiosity, new opportunities
w-11.reversed: lack of inspiration, missed opportunities, impulsive actions, recklessness
w-11.description: A young person with a wand, looking out at the desert landscape.

w-12.name: Knight of Wands
w-12.reversed: hasty actions, recklessness, impulsiveness, lack of direction, burnout
w-12.description: A knight on a horse, charging forward with a wand.

w-13.name: Queen of Wands
w-13.reversed: insecurity, dependency, domineering, lack of self-belief, manipulation
w-13.description: A queen on a throne, holding a sunflower wand.

w-14.name: King of Wands
w-14.description: A king on a throne, holding a flaming wand.

c-1.name: Ace of Cups
c-1.meaning: emotional new beginnings, love, intuition, compassion, happiness
c-1.reversed: emotional blockage, emptiness, apathy, lack of love, missed opportunity
c-1.description: A hand holding a cup overflowing with water, a dove descending.

c-2.name: Two of Cups
c-2.description: A man and woman, exchanging cups in front of a Caduceus.

c-3.name: Three of Cups
c-3.description: Three women raising cups in celebration.

c-4.name: Four of Cups
c-4.reversed: new perspectives, acceptance, re-engagement, gratitude, opportunities
c-4.description: A man sitting under a tree, contemplating three cups.

c-5.name: Five of Cups
c-5.meaning: loss, disappointment, grief, regret, emotional pain
c-5.reversed: forgiveness, acceptance, moving on, finding silver linings
c-5.description: A man with three spilled cups and two remaining, turned away.

c-6.name: Six of Cups
c-6.meaning: nostalgia, childhood memories, innocence, reunions, joy
c-6.reversed: living in the past, unrealistic nostalgia, unwilling to move on
c-6.description: Two children exchanging cups, surrounded by flowers.

c-7.name: Seven of Cups
c-7.reversed: facing reality, clarity, making decisions, grounding, focus
c-7.description: A man looking at seven cups, each with different visions.

c-8.name: Eight of Cups
c-8.reversed: unwilling to walk away, fear of change, staying in a stagnant situation
c-8.description: A man walking away from eight cups, towards the mountains.

c-9.name: Nine of Cups
c-9.meaning: happiness, fulfillment, contentment, emotional satisfaction, wish fulfillment
c-9.reversed: overindulgence, smugness, materialism, delayed gratification, superficiality
c-9.description: A man sitting with nine cups, appearing satisfied.

c-10.name: Ten of Cups
c-10.meaning: emotional fulfillment, joy, family, harmony, contentment
c-10.reversed: broken family, discord, disconnection, unhappiness, unfulfilled dreams
c-10.description: A family celebrating under a rainbow of ten cups.

c-11.name: Page of Cups
c-11.meaning: dreams, intuition, creativity, messages, new feelings
c-11.reversed: emotional immaturity, unrealistic fantasies, moodiness, deception
c-11.description: A young person with a cup and fish emerging from it.

c-12.name: Knight of Cups
c-12.reversed: moodiness, unrealistic expectations, emotional manipulation, deceptiveness
c-12.description: A knight on a horse, holding a cup, wearing flowing armor.

c-13.name: Queen of Cups
c-13.meaning: empathy, intuition, compassion, emotional support, kindness
c-13.reversed: martyrdom, over-sensitivity, emotional insecurity, hidden agendas
c-13.description: A queen seated on a throne with a cup and a seashell.

c-14.name: King of Cups
c-14.meaning: compassion, control over emotions, balance, wisdom, maturity
c-14.reversed: emotional instability, mood swings, manipulation, emotional detachment
c-14.description: A king on a throne with a cup, holding a fish.

s-1.name: Ace of Swords
s-1.reversed: confusion, chaos, false starts, lack of clarity, mental blocks
s-1.description: A hand holding a sword, with a crown and wreath above.

s-2.name: Two of Swords
s-2.meaning: indecision, choices, truce, balance, blocked emotions
s-2.reversed: indecision, confusion, stalemate, avoidance, facing a difficult choice
s-2.description: A woman with two swords crossed over her chest, blindfolded.

s-3.name: Three of Swords
s-3.meaning: heartbreak, sorrow, grief, emotional pain, betrayal
s-3.reversed: healing, forgiveness, moving on, releasing pain, recovery
s-3.description: A heart pierced by three swords, often with rain falling.

s-4.name: Four of Swords
s-4.reversed: restlessness, burnout, inability to rest, overthinking, delayed healing
s-4.description: A figure resting on a tomb with three swords above.

s-5.name: Five of Swords
s-5.reversed: reconciliation, making amends, letting go of resentment, forgiveness
s-5.description: A man with three swords, two figures with dropped swords behind him.

s-6.name: Six of Swords
s-6.meaning: transition, recovery, moving on, guidance, support
s-6.reversed: stuck in the past, unfinished business, resistance to change, unhelpful support
s-6.description: A woman and child being rowed in a boat, leaving troubled waters behind.

s-7.name: Seven of Swords
s-7.reversed: exposure, self-acceptance, facing the truth, ownership, reclaiming stolen ideas
s-7.description: A man stealing five swords, leaving two behind.

s-8.name: Eight of Swords
s-8.meaning: entrapment, powerlessness, restriction, self-imposed limits, fear
s-8.reversed: self-liberation, freedom, facing fears, finding solutions, breaking free
s-8.description: A woman blindfolded and bound, surrounded by eight swords.

s-9.name: Nine of Swords
s-9.meaning: anxiety, nightmares, despair, guilt, mental anguish
s-9.reversed: release of anxiety, facing fears, recovery, seeking help, finding solutions
s-9.description: A woman sitting up in bed, her head in her hands, with nine swords above her.

s-10.name: Ten of Swords
s-10.meaning: endings, betrayal, rock bottom, collapse, painful transition
s-10.reversed: recovery, release, new beginnings, hitting rock bottom, learning from pain
s-10.description: A man lying face down with ten swords in his back.

s-11.name: Page of Swords
s-11.meaning: curiosity, mental agility, new ideas, exploration, youthful energy
s-11.reversed: immaturity, impulsiveness, hasty actions, thoughtlessness, lack of focus
s-11.description: A young person with a sword, looking alert and focused.

s-12.name: Knight of Swords
s-12.meaning: action, determination, decisiveness, assertiveness, swift change
s-12.description: A knight charging forward on a horse, with a raised sword.

s-13.name: Queen of Swords
s-13.meaning: clarity, independence, maturity, logical thinking, truthfulness
s-13.reversed: harsh judgment, coldness, cruelty, bitterness, cutting remarks
s-13.description: A queen with a sword, often holding it pointed upwards.

s-14.name: King of Swords
s-14.reversed: abuse of power, manipulation, tyranny, coldness, dishonesty
s-14.description: A king with a sword, often seated and holding the sword upright.

p-1.name: Ace of Pentacles
p-1.meaning: new opportunities, prosperity, abundance, potential, manifestation
p-1.reversed: missed opportunities, lack of progress, financial issues, lack of stability
p-1.description: A hand holding a pentacle with a lush garden in the background.

p-2.name: Two of Pentacles
p-2.meaning: balance, adaptability, juggling priorities, change, multitasking
p-2.reversed: imbalanced priorities, overwhelmed, unable to cope, loss of balance
p-2.description: A person juggling two pentacles with two ships in the background.

p-3.name: Three of Pentacles
p-3.reversed: lack of teamwork, criticism, conflict, poor workmanship, unappreciated
p-3.description: Three people working together on a building project.

p-4.name: Four of Pentacles
p-4.reversed: greed, materialism, possessiveness, holding back, fear of loss
p-4.description: A man holding onto four pentacles, closed off to the world.

p-5.name: Five of Pentacles
p-5.meaning: hard times, poverty, insecurity, hardship, financial loss
p-5.reversed: recovery, improved finances, finding help, relief, spiritual poverty
p-5.description: Two people in rags outside a church in the snow.

p-6.name: Six of Pentacles
p-6.reversed: selfishness, greed, stinginess, debt, financial inequality
p-6.description: A man giving to two beggars, with scales in the background.

p-7.name: Seven of Pentacles
p-7.meaning: assessment, patience, long-term view, reward, investment
p-7.reversed: impatience, lack of long-term vision, investments not paying off, impatience
p-7.description: A person assessing the growth of pentacles on a plant.

p-8.name: Eight of Pentacles
p-8.reversed: perfectionism, boredom, lack of progress, lack of skills, mediocrity
p-8.description: A person working on pentacles with focus and precision.

p-9.name: Nine of Pentacles
p-9.reversed: dependence, financial setbacks, lost independence, isolation, excess
p-9.description: A woman in a lush garden with a falcon on her arm.

p-10.name: Ten of Pentacles
p-10.meaning: legacy, wealth, family, financial stability, prosperity
p-10.reversed: financial loss, family disputes, lost legacy, instability, greed
p-10.description: A family with a rich couple, children, and a dog in front of a grand house.

p-11.name: Page of Pentacles
p-11.meaning: learning, curiosity, new skills, diligence, practicality
p-11.reversed: lack of focus, missed opportunities, immaturity, naivety, poor work
p-11.description: A young person with a pentacle, focusing on it with curiosity.

p-12.name: Knight of Pentacles
p-12.meaning: responsibility, hard work, thoroughness, reliability, efficiency
p-12.reversed: lack of responsibility, laziness, apathy, workaholism, micromanagement
p-12.description: A knight on a horse, holding a pentacle, focused on the path.

p-13.name: Queen of Pentacles
p-13.reversed: dependency, smothering, possessiveness, financial insecurity, neglect
p-13.description: A queen with a pentacle, surrounded by lush nature.

p-14.name: King of Pentacles
p-14.reversed: financial instability, materialism, greed, tyranny, miserliness
p-14.description: A king with a pentacle, often seated on a throne.
